title: Suspect in toddler's shooting: 'It was an accident'
content:
The man accused of fatally shooting a 17-month-old boy broke into tears in court Friday afternoon and told a judge, "It was an accident."
Ronnie Howard appeared before a magistrate judge Friday afternoon at the Bibb County jail.
The Bibb County Sheriff's Office says he was cleaning a gun at a home off Thomaston Road on Thursday in west Bibb County when it discharged, killing Victor Carroll
He is charged with second-degree murder and second-degree child cruelty.
When the judge read the charges against him, Howard began crying and said, "Really?"
He tried to speak, but deputies told him to be quiet.
Finally, he told the judge the shooting was an accident.
Howard remains in the Bibb County jail without bond.
